Speaker: alex
Dialogue: That's okay.  I've got a test coming up anyway.  Gotta study.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: He's a basket case.  You've talked to him. You know that.  He might as well be dead too.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: It's like I said.  It's just part of the past now.  It doesn't matter anymore.

Speaker: nick

Dialogue: I was thinking about writing for one of those Filipino mail order brides...

Dialogue: I think I saw that on the Home Shopping Network.  The Girlfriend Hour, right after Auto Accessories.

Dialogue: What the hell does that mean?

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: Fucked up.  That's what they said I was.

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: Yeah, but only because I want to be.

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: Would you guys knock it off?

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: Listen to me, Alex.  These counselor's don't know anything.  They're full of shit. If you don't fit the pattern of the perfect kid, they freak.

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: So tell me you're okay, then.

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: Good.   Cause I'd freak if you weren't.

Speaker: benz
Dialogue: You guys going to Dante's after school?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: That's the new Slip-Stream game. Those guys are good.  It's supposed to be interactive. Graphics are unbelievable.

Speaker: benz
Dialogue: Yeah?  They were handing these out at Dante's.  Test marketing it or something. Gonna have a demonstration today.

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: Of course I can.  I can say all sorts of things...

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: Come on.  We'll hit Dante's after school, try the game out, maybe get some dinner.

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: Sure.  Never come back.  Disappear forever.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Super computers, micro-processors... That's the future we're looking at.

Speaker: deloach
Dialogue: So how come they're previewing it in this shit-hole?

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: If you weren't such a dick, you'd know what a cool place this was.

Speaker: deloach
Dialogue: Gimme a break, they got fucking Space Invaders here.  That's shit's for retards.

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: So...are you trying to say I'm retarded? Is that what you're implying?

Speaker: deloach
Dialogue: No, but since I'm standing here, I'm noticing that you're an ugly little fuck and you're making me sick...

Speaker: finster
Dialogue: No it's not.  You guys are shits and I'm throwing you out.

Speaker: deloach
Dialogue: Your place sucks.  Who gives a shit about "ARCADE" anyway?

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: We're glad you people could make it, and we're anxious to have you try out our new product.  We think it's going to be a big seller.  But you're the people that make it happen.  You're the market share everyone's tearing each other apart to get at.  It's your opinion that's going to make or break us.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: So what's so different about Arcade? You guys've been talking about it for months.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: A man after my own heart.  Straight to the point.  What's different about ARCADE is the way it reacts.  It responds like a human does.  It learns.  It adapts. Each time you play, it changes its strategy.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: Is it?  Why don't you see for your self?

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: The CyberGloves are keyed into the game's response mechanism.  You'll be able to pick things up inside the world...tools, weapons ... it'll feel like they're really in your hands...

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: The goggles heighten the experience. When we said "Reality will never be the same", we weren't kidding.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: In case things get too intense.  It automatically freezes the game, gives you a breather.  Things can get pretty wild...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: So what's the scenario?  Am I saving a princess?  Fighting Zombies?

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: It changes.  There are eleven levels. Each one is a different layer of the ARCADE universe.  The concept is, you're entering the video game itself, making your way across the circuit board to the logic core ... ARCADE's brain.

Speaker: arcade
Dialogue: I AM ARCADE.  YOU WANT TO PLAY GAMES?  YOU PICKED THE WRONG MACHINE.

Speaker: arcade
Dialogue: ONE WORD OF ADVICE, NICK.  YOU SPEND TOO MUCH TIME IN ONE PLACE, AND I SEND OUT THE SCREAMER.  YOU DON'T WANT TO BE AROUND WHEN THAT HAPPENS.  SEE YOU ON THE OTHER SIDE.

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: So how do I get back in?

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: Here's what we're going to do.  What I'm holding are the home versions of ARCADE, the prototypes...

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: In a month or so we're planning on releasing ARCADE in both versions, but we're still fine tuning, and that's where you guys luck out.  So what we'll do is have you register with us, and then we're going to loan these out to you for a week or so.  The only thing you have to do in return is answer some marketing questions. Sound fair?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: He's still working on the game.

Speaker: kid
Dialogue: Don't know.  I think I saw him walk out, but I'm not sure...

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: He's probably outside.  You know how he is. Gets bored...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Guess he took off...  You have his keys, right?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hmmm.  He said you were going to have dinner?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: So take his car home.  Wait.  I'm sure he's up to something...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: But he was playing the game.  I mean, you saw him...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's nothing, okay?  Just take his car home. He'll show up.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You should go to bed, Dad.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Listen to me!  Greg never came home. I think the game has something to do with it.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I have to talk to you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Alex, you don't know how long I've waited for this.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Isn't it amazing?  It's a sort of rest position in the game, when you're between levels.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: They're fractals.  Visual representations of mathematic equations.  The game is totally brilliant.  I mean, look at it, it's like a DNA molecule or something...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Greg never came home.  A few hours is one thing, Nick, but this is different. Something's happened to him.

Dialogue: Can you turn off the game?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'm in the middle of it...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No.  I think the game's alive somehow.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No, wait.  Just listen.  I hooked it up earlier tonight, and it said my name.  As soon as I turned it on, Nick.  It said my name.  How could it know?  And then, I asked it where Greg was, and it said, "In here".

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Alex, I think you're freaking out. Greg's gone, I'll give you that.  And maybe he's in trouble.  But it's not ARCADE that's doing it...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: How?!  It's a machine, Alex. Machine's don't think.  They're not alive.  It's a good program, a brilliant program, it was designed so it would act as if it were alive, but it's not alive.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: So how did it know my name, then?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: See, men always do this.  "Quiet down, honey.  Chill out.  Take a Valium". I'm not a fucking idiot, Nick!  I DID NOT IMAGINE IT!!!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Quiet.  I do have parents, you know.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: It turned itself back on, Nick.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No it didn't.  It's just a faulty relay or something.  It happens.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: It's alive, Nick.  It's listening to us ...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Just shut up!  Enough already, okay?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sorry.  Maybe I need the Valium.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'll try Stilts.  He's got insomnia.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's the middle of the night.  They're asleep.  Phone didn't wake them.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Look, why are you fucking with me like this?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Because I didn't know where else to go.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's two o'clock in the morning.  Go home. Go to sleep.  We'll figure something out in the morning.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's not this weird.  It'll make sense. Everything gets weird this late anyway, right?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: If I were you, I'd think twice about playing that game again.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Everybody's sick, huh?  It's fifteen after.  We always meet here, you know that.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Did you play ARCADE last night?

Dialogue: Actually, no.  I was just telling Nick, here, that my t.v.'s busted...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You want to hear something else, Nick? I tried to call them this morning...Greg, Benz, Laurie...  Their phones are out of order.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: And then I started thinking...about everyone else that was at Dante's yesterday.  I drew up this list. DeLoach, those other jerks ... their phones are out of order too.

Dialogue: So what do you want me to do?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: We have to find out what's happened to them. I think they're gone...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: If they're sick, great.  But let's make sure.  Come on, Nick.

Dialogue: Okay.  We'll see what's up.  But if things are cool, I don't want to hear anything more about this.  Life's too short, know what I mean?

Dialogue: I'll call the National Guard.  I got it under control.  Oh, just one more thing. One you need garlic and silver bullets for, the other...

Dialogue: Just do what she said.  Don't watch television.

Dialogue: We'll call 911.  Look around Alex.  We broke in, smashed the t.v., no one's going to believe what happened here!

Dialogue: I believe you now.  I don't know what the fuck just happened, but it did. Now let's get the hell out of here.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: My house.  I want to try something.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Okay.  I'm going inside.  If I'm not back out in, say, two minutes, you get the hell out of here.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: We need to find a pay-phone.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's not just the cable system.  It's in the phone system as well, the electronic net.  It's everywhere.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Maybe it is alive in a way...some sort of electronic intelligence.  It's like a computer virus that developed a personality or something.  It's self-replicating...it mimics life.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's growing.  Getting stronger. Maybe it's only localized now...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Right.  And then communication satellites, and then anywhere.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: We have to stop it from getting out.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Give me a break, Alex.  What are we going to tell them?  Excuse me, officer, but there's some sort of electronic monster loose in the phone lines.  I'd think twice about calling any of those 976 numbers...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: They made ARCADE.  It's still a game, right?  It thinks like a game.  Maybe it still has to play by the rules. Someone had to program it in the first place, didn't they?.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You mean we learn the rules...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: And beat it at it's own game.

Dialogue: You realize that in order to do that, we'd actually have to play the game.

Dialogue: I was afraid you'd say that.

Dialogue: We need to see Mr. Difford.

Dialogue: I see.  And do you have an appointment?

Dialogue: No, but it's important and if you'd...

Dialogue: I'm sorry, but if you don't have an appointment, I won't be able to help you. If you'd like, you can call his office from our courtesy phone outside and schedule one ...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: If Difford's not out here it one minute we're calling the news and informing them that your fucking games are whispering in our ears and telling us to commit suicide. I'm talking public relations nightmare here, buddy.  Satanism, virgin sacrifices, backward messages, the whole bit.

Speaker: receptionist
Dialogue: Mr. Difford will be right with you.

Dialogue: Nick, Alex, how are we today?

Dialogue: How'd you know it was us?

Dialogue: Now what seems to be the problem?

Dialogue: That's gotta be the understatement of the century.  It's killing people.

Dialogue: If this is a joke, I'm not laughing.

Dialogue: Neither are we.  Something's wrong with the game, Mr. Difford.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: Why don't we take this into my office.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: There's something wrong with ARCADE. The game's alive somehow...

Dialogue: What Alex is trying to say is that it "seems" like it's alive.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I mean, you don't want us kids running around school saying your game's too hard, right?

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: That's what this is all about? Tricks? Sure, I'd be happy to introduce you to ARCADE's programmer.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: Tell you what, I'll take you down to our R&D labs right now.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: This is one of our newest projects. We're trying to get rid of joy-sticks altogether ...

Dialogue: The Air-Force is working on the same thing.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: This is Nick and Alex.  They'd like to talk to you about ARCADE.  Maybe you can give them a few programmer's secrets.

Speaker: difford
Dialogue: Then I leave you in capable hands.

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Getting there.  It's more sensitive than a joy-stick.  Your video-character can respond as fast as you can.  But what can I do for you?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: We're having some problems with ARCADE...

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: It's a tough game.  Hard to pin that bastard down.  Keeps on changing the rules.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: We vere thinking there might be tricks. You know, surprises that you'd worked into the game...

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Sure.  Every game's got 'em.  I'll start with the schematics.  I can print these up if you want.

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: You've got your ten levels, right? Here they are...  Each level has an exit, only remember, the exits aren't always what they seem.  First one's The Blood Red Sky, then you've got The Blue Desert, Tower of Ghosts, Kingdom of the Blind...  On each world you have to find a golden key and you've only got so much time to do it in.  If you're too late, The Screamer comes.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: How do you stop The Screamer?

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: You can't.  He gets you and you're dead. It's like time catching up with you, you know?  Like Fate.  Each level you get progressively less time to complete.  First half of the game takes place in the Wild Lands.  Then you reach Level 6, and that's the Sea of Darkness.  There's a two-headed Boatman that'll take you across if you answer his riddle right.  If you don't...

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: If I tell you, then it's no fun.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Just tell me the fucking riddle.

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Well...it involves a paradox.  You have to trick The Boatman.  Now all the while, you also have to watch your strength.  You can build that back up by catching FIREFLIES...the little glowing guys...

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: The next half of the game takes place in ARCADE's brain, The City of Truth. It's urban scenarios, lots of metal and concrete. Screamer comes faster here.  On Level Four you can get a free life if you wait until the last possible second before exiting that world.  Gotta time it right though.

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Level Ten.  That's where you've got to unlock ARCADE's heart using the keys you've found.

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Good question.  See, that's where the fun comes in.  ARCADE changes it every time. He's a machine without a soul. Once you give him a soul, he stops being a threat.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: But how can it change every time?

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: It's the game's logic core.  We actually patterned it after human brainwaves.  I mean, there's a personality in there. That's what makes it so incredible.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: How the hell did you do that?

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Well, we're veering into classified info here, but I'll tell you that it involved a donor.  He was dead of course, so it's not like anything unethical was happening.

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Well, brain-dead anyway.  Coma patient. It's really not all that important.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: The donor.  Maybe he's alive inside the game.

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: And maybe you've been taking too many drugs.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Could you play ARCADE with that?

Speaker: albert
Dialogue: Well, technically "yes", but this is only the prototype.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Thanks, Albert.  Think you could print up those schematics?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Go outside, get your car, and meet me out front with the engine running. And make it quick, okay?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Get that helmet.  If we're going to play ARCADE, I want every advantage possible.

Dialogue: SECURITY BREACH IN R&D.  SUBJECT HEADING TOWARDS EASTERN EXIT...

Dialogue: I can't believe you made it!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: So where do we play the game, Nick?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I've been thinking about that.  ARCADE's like a virus, so it seems like the place to hit him would be where the virus started.  You know, like his point of origin?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: The windows are barred...  There's a skylight.  We can get in through the roof.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Shit...it's like a trance or something...  Okay.  I'm fine.  Really.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Put it out of your head, Alex.  It's just trying to psyche us out.

Speaker: nick

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I don't understand.  It wants us to play the game.  It's been taunting us ...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It can turn itself on, Alex!  It doesn't need a quarter.

Dialogue: Yes it does.  Don't you see?  We have to play by the rules.  That's what it wants.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Two players, Nick.  You need to put in another quarter.

Dialogue: I know how to do this!  I'm good at these games.  You never play, you'd be nailed in an instant.

Dialogue: And what if something happens to you? Am I suppose to go in after you alone?!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.  If you're smart, you run like hell.

Dialogue: You don't get it, do you?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I don't want anything to happen to you.  I care about you.

Dialogue: I already have a boyfriend, Nick.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What can I say?  Tough being a hero, isn't it?

Dialogue: NICK.  ALEX.  I MISSED YOU SO MUCH. ALL YOUR FRIENDS ARE HERE.

Speaker: arcade
Dialogue: A HEARTLESS MONSTER, OF COURSE.  OH SAVE ME, ALEX, SAVE ME FROM MYSELF.

Dialogue: Thanks.  Always wanted to do that.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Yeah, well I figure these are unusual circumstances.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: That's what I was hoping you'd say.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'll take the lead and handle the physical threats.  You watch the elapsed time and look for exits.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You steer by pivoting your back foot...  Okay?

Dialogue: Which way do you think Level Two is?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Oh shit!  What if they didn't come with us?!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: The keys are supposed to be at the end of each level.  Once we get all the keys, we can unlock ARCADE's heart. And then...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: ...and then we go to the Final Level.  Hey, don't worry about it.  It's a game. How bad could it be?

Dialogue: I don't get it.  This is supposed to be the end of the level, but it doesn't go anywhere.

Dialogue: It only looks like it leads to nowhere.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: And we've still got time left.  This was a piece of cake.

Dialogue: Hey, my strength's low.  Look out for Fireflies.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: According to this, the doorway should be somewhere around here...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Nick!  It's beneath the water!  We have to swim!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: So that's what we almost died for?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: One of them, anyway...  Did you see it?  The Screamer?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I don't want to talk about it.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: We can take the dunes down like a ski slope. Pretend you're on a snowboard.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I guess we're walking from here on out.

Speaker: benz
Dialogue: Get me out of here!  Oh God!!!

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: You may ask one of us a question. One tells the truth, and the other lies. Who you ask, remains your discretion. But if the answer is wrong, the questioner dies.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: One of these cities, is the place you seek. The Teller of Truths will take you there. But the City of Lies, is dark and bleak. And death is certain if you enter, beware.

Dialogue: I am The Liar.  Where should I take you?

Dialogue: I am the Truth Teller.  Where should I take you?

Dialogue: What did he do to you?

Dialogue: Think!  I want to go to the City of Truth, and the Truth Teller is from there...but which one is which?  The liar...think!

Dialogue: You have no time.  What is your question?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Liar.  Did you come from the city on the left, or the city on the right?

Speaker: stilts
Dialogue: I came from the city on the left.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: But you always lie, so you didn't come from there.  That means the city on the left must be the City of Truth.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Take me to the city on the left!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: How did you get here?  Did you play the game?!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Can you hang onto my back?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: There's a monster here.  We have to kill it before we can leave.  That's what we have to do.  I know it's scary, but I won't let anything happen to you.  Okay?

Dialogue: Dark Riders!  If they touch us, we're dead!

Dialogue: In this world, wrong is right!

Dialogue: We have to go in there, don't we?

Dialogue: Okay.  I'm here, ARCADE. Where are you?

Dialogue: YOU'RE TOO LATE, ALEX.  YOU'VE ALWAYS BEEN TOO LATE.  AND NOW YOUR TIME'S UP.  YOU SEE, I NEEDED SOMEONE TO RETRIEVE MY HEART FOR ME.  I COULDN'T DO IT MYSELF.  THOSE ARE THE RULES. Dialogue: YOU'RE NOT DYING YET, ALEX.  YOU HAVEN'T BEEN TO THE FINAL LEVEL. LEVEL TEN.

Dialogue: Time.  That's all I ever think about anymore.  It's like there's never enough of it, you know?

Dialogue: I miss you so much, Alex.  I want so much to be with you...

Dialogue: I love you, Alex.  I never wanted to leave. You know that, don't you?

Dialogue: Magic.  We'll be together again.  I know you don't believe in an afterlife, but there is one.  Heaven is real.

Dialogue: Is...is that where we are?  Did I die?

Speaker: arcade
Dialogue: OH ALEX.  SO SORRY.  BUT DON'T YOU WORRY, I'LL BRING YOU BACK IN THE GAME.  MAYBE I'LL EVEN GIVE YOU HEAVEN.

Dialogue: Guess what, ass-hole?  You forgot about my free life!!!

Dialogue: I just thought of something.  If we came back from the game...  ...what if ARCADE did too?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Okay.  Forget I ever said it.
